title: Lionel Messi's return to Barcelona's starting line-up has seen them go from 1.4 to 3 points a game
text:
Lionel Messi's long-awaited return to Barcelona's starting line-up has handed the champions' bid to retain their title a welcome boost.

Without the Argentine superstar, the La Liga giants found themselves languishing in seventh spot with a 40 per cent win ratio and collecting 1.4 points per game on average.

But with Messi fit and firing after recovering from a plague of injuries this season, Ernesto Valverde's men now boast a 100 per cent win record and climbed to the top of the standings with victory against Eibar on Saturday.

Lionel Messi's return from injury has breathed new life into Barcelona's title challenge

The 32-year-old has had to endure a lengthy wait for regular top flight action this term after missing Barcelona's first four league clashes due to a calf problem.

He was eased back into the team with an appearance from the bench against Granada, and was soon handed his first start of the campaign three days later.

However, his eagerly-anticipated return to fitness was again cut short in the clash with Villarreal after the mercurial attacker suffered a thigh injury.

Despite receiving treatment at the side of the pitch, Messi had to be replaced at the half-time break by Ousmane Dembele.

The reigning champions had been averaging just 1.4 points per game with Messi sidelined

But after missing out on the champions' trip to Getafe in September, Messi battled back to earn a starting spot against Inter Milan in the Champions League and has since played the full 90 minutes in Barcelona's next two league fixtures.

To little surprise, the five-time Balon d'Or winner has netted in both games and breathed new life into the club's title defence.

Barcelona hurtled up the table and are now one point clear of arch rivals Real Madrid following their shock defeat against Real Mallorca - their first of the season.

And with an abundance of attacking talent to choose from, boss Valverde is spoiled for choice in his selections as he plots yet another domestic crown for the Catalan giants.
